thread.title_full: Oakridge Lightning Complex burning more than 7,500 acres

title: Oakridge Lightning Complex burning more than 7,500 acres
text: Oakridge Lightning Complex burning more than 7,500 acres Weather Alert ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Temperatures up to 99. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Oregon and southwest Washington. * WHEN...Until 11 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sunshine, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Take extra precautions when outside. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing. Try to limit strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Take action when you see symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1. && Currently in Eugene 97°F Sunny 97°F / 61°F 5 PM 97°F 6 PM 94°F 7 PM 90°F 8 PM 86°F 9 PM 81°F © Copyright 2024 [Allen Media Broadcasting](https://allenmediabroadcasting.com/), 2975 Chad Drive Eugene, OR | [Terms of Use](/site/terms.html)| [Privacy Policy](/site/privacy.html) Powered by
